item.title: “Freedom Must be an Ideal with a Social Content”
item.dc:creator: barazaonline
item.description: From The Sunday Observer of October 22, 1944 The following message was sent by Mr. M.N. Roy to the Bengal Provincial Conference of the Radical Democratic Party held on October 14/15, 1944 at Jaynagar under the presidentship of A.N. Chattopadyay M.L.A. (Central) Dear Comrades, More than half a century has passed since the place of the … Continue reading “Freedom Must be an Ideal with a Social Content” →

item.title: Paul Divakar Mentors “‘The Annihilation of Caste’ Reading Group” at Columbia
item.dc:creator: Lakshmi Gopal
item.category: The Annihilation of Caste Reading Group
item.description: Recording of the session available on SoundCloud: Paul Divaker Mentors The Annihilation of Caste Reading Group “..People sometimes ask…why the Pope does not introduce this or that reform? The true answer is that a revolutionist is not the kind of man who becomes a Pope and that a man who becomes a Pope has no wish … Continue reading Paul Divakar Mentors “‘The Annihilation of Caste’ Reading Group” at Columbia →

item.title: Good Violence, Bad Violence
item.dc:creator: Hamza Saif
item.description: Written in the aftermath of September 11, 2001, Mahmood Mamdani’s 2005 book Good Muslim, BadMuslim historicizes the violence of terrorism. It extricates terrorism from the narrow morality that arises from the convergence of ethics and national interest, and instead locates terrorism “first and foremost as unfinished business of the Cold War.”1 “Good” and “bad” Muslims, terms borrowed from former … Continue reading Good Violence, Bad Violence →

item.title: Images from the Present and a Letter from the Past
item.dc:creator: barazaonline
item.category: The Annihilation of Caste Reading Group
item.description: These pictures were taken at the Dalit Adivasi Mahasamelanam, in November 2012, where tens of thousands of Dalits and Adivasis, including families of men, women, children, the elderly and in some cases, entire village communities, gathered together at the famous Ramlila Grounds in New Delhi in a campaign to end caste, caste discrimination, and caste … Continue reading Images from the Present and a Letter from the Past →

item.title: Protests in India: Who Will be the Final Victim of this Anger?
item.dc:creator: Lakshmi Gopal
item.description: On December 16, a 23 year-old woman was brutally gang-raped, within an inch of her life, in a public bus with an illegal license that was driving through the streets for half an hour, unnoticed. Like Khaled Mohamed Saeed and Mohammed Bouazizi, this young anonymous woman has become the emblem of an angry nation. For students in New … Continue reading Protests in India: Who Will be the Final Victim of this Anger? →
